I am a Full Professor in the School of Computer Science, Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU). At SJTU, I'm a proud member of Emerging Parallel Computing Center (EPCC) and I direct Sustainable Architecture and Intelligence Lab (SAIL). Prior to joining SJTU, I earned my PhD degree from the University of Florida and my BS degree from Zhejiang University (with honors). Research Interests My primary research area is system SW/HW architecture design with an emphasis on energy-efficient, high-performance computers of extreme scales. I devise innovative cross-layer approaches to improve the scalability, sustainability, and manageability of today's computing infrastructure. My broader interests also include evolving applications, emerging technologies, and transformative tools that could ultimately shape the next-generation intelligent computing paradigms.
